summary:
AP CSA Java course: Using Objects
- The course covers creation and use of Java objects.
- The course is based on CSAwesome Unit 2.
title: CSAJava.Unit02.UsingObjects
authors: Rick Brunson, Team Brunson Software, LLC

src/Main.java.name: src/Main.java

placeholders.placeholder_text: /* Change Bowie's status to record that he is sleeping. */
/* Print each cat's information to the console on a separate line. */

src/Cat.java.name: src/Cat.java

task_list.description_text:
Cat Class: What are Objects and Classes?

The goal of this task is to help you become familiar with Java classes and using instances of Java classes called objects. this task includes two classes, Main and Cat. Your objective is to write the missing code in the Main class to:

  • Output information for each cat instance to the console.
  • Modify the status of the cat named Bowie to record that he is sleeping.
Review how the default cat's information was output using System.out.println().
Review how the panda cat status was set to sleeping.

References:

  • 2.1. Objects - Instances of Classes
  • 2.2. Creating and Initializing Objects: Constructors

Check your modified Main class by clicking the 'Check' button at the bottom of this page.

src/Cat.java.name: src/Cat.java

      the cat is sleeping */

test/Tests.java.name: test/Tests.java

src/Main.java.name: src/Main.java

task_list.description_text:
Cat Class: Instance Variables & Methods

Implement the Cat class by adding instance variables (attributes) and methods (behaviors).

Implement the following instance variables (attributes):

  • name as a string.
  • age as an int.
  • color as a string.
  • isSleeping as a boolean

Implement the following methods (behaviors):

  • Public Cat constructor without parameters:
    • Set name = ""
    • Set age = Integer.MIN_VALUE
    • Set color = ""
    • Set isSleeping = false
  • Public Cat constructor with parameters: public Cat(String name, int age, String color)
    • Set name = name
    • Set age = age
    • Set color = color
    • Set isSleeping = false
  • Public sleeps() method:
    • Set isSleeping = true
When a class method parameter has the same as the class instance variable, use this.varName = varName to set the class instance variable. For example:
    this.name = name;

References:

  • 2.1. Objects - Instances of Classes
  • 2.2. Creating and Initializing Objects: Constructors

Check your modified Main class by clicking the 'Check' button at the bottom of this page.

test/Tests.java.name: test/Tests.java

task_list.description_text:
Unit 2 Lesson 1 Exit Ticket: Fraction Class

Implement a class that computes the fraction of two numbers.

  • Create the Fraction class constructor to accept the numerator and denominator.
    • public Fraction(type numerator, type denominator)
    • Create/initialize instance variables to represent these values
  • Create a Fraction class method named getDecimal() that returns the value of the fraction as a decimal.
public type getDecimal()
Be sure to use the correct numeric return type.

References:

  • 2.1. Objects - Instances of Classes
  • 2.2. Creating and Initializing Objects: Constructors

Check your modified Main class by clicking the 'Check' button at the bottom of this page.

task_list.name: Methods with Parameters

src/Main.java.name: src/Main.java

task_list.description_text:
Methods with Parameters

Method Declaration: public int sum(int a, int b) { return a + b; }

Method Components

  • Method Header: public int sum(int a, int b)
  • Method Signature: sum(int a, int b)
  • Access Specifier: public
  • Return Type: int
  • Method Name: sum
  • Parameter List: (int a, int b)
  • Method Body: { return a + b; }

References:
  • SimpleTurtle Class Javadoc
  • AP CSA Java Quick Reference
  • 2.4. Calling Methods With Parameters
  • Javatpoint: Java Methods

Click 'Next' to continue.

task_list.name: Turtle House

src/Main.java.name: src/Main.java

task_list.description_text:
Programming Challenge : Turtle House

Follow the repl.it link, fork the solution (or wait for a multiplayer link for collaborative coding) and try the following tasks.

This creative challenge is fun to do collaboratively in groups. Design a house and have the turtle draw it with different colors (use this repl.it link). Can you add windows and a door? Come up with your own house design as a team.

To draw a window, you will need to do penUp() to walk the turtle into position, for example:
    builder.penUp();
    builder.moveTo(120,200);
    builder.penDown();

Turtle Class Diagram

Turtle : SimpleTurtle
Constructor Signatures:
Turtle(World world)
Turtle(int x, int y, World world)
Attributes:
bodyColor : Color
shellColor : Color
width : int = 15
height : int = 18
xpos : int = 0
ypos : int = 0
Methods:
forward()
backward()
turnLeft()
turnRight()
penUp()
penDown()
forward(pixels : int)
backward(pixels : int)
turn(degrees : double)
getXPos()
getYPos()
moveTo(x: int, y: int)
setColor(pen : Color)
setColor(bodyColor : Color, shellColor : Color)
setWidth(width : int)
setHeight(height : int)
References:
  • SimpleTurtle Class Javadoc
  • AP CSA Java Quick Reference
  • 2.4. Calling Methods With Parameters
  • Javatpoint: Java Methods

Click 'Next' to continue.

task_list.name: Turtle Practice - Bonus

src/Main.java.name: src/Main.java

task_list.description_text:
Turtles Practice - Bonus

Follow the repl.it link, fork the solution fork the solution (or wait for a multiplayer link for collaborative coding) and try the following tasks.

  1. Can you make yertle draw a square and change the pen color for each side of the square? Try something like: yertle.setColor(Color.red); This uses the Color class in Java which has some colors predefined like red, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan. You can also use more specific methods like setPenColor(...), setBodyColor(...), and setShellColor(...).
  2. Can you draw a triangle? The turnRight() method always does 90 degree turns, but youll need external angles of 120 degree for an equilateral triangle. Use the turn method which has a parameter for the angle of the turn in degrees. For example, turn(90) is the same as turnRight(). Try drawing a triangle with different colors.

Turtle Class Diagram

Turtle : SimpleTurtle
Constructor Signatures:
Turtle(World world)
Turtle(int x, int y, World world)
Attributes:
bodyColor : Color
shellColor : Color
width : int = 15
height : int = 18
xpos : int = 0
ypos : int = 0
Methods:

turnRight()

penDown()
